data.title: Blog
data.meta_description: Welcome to our blog! Here all the info that might be useful for you, content about our courses and the experiences at Europass Teacher Academy.
data.text:
English Language Course (Intermediate Level)

LANG.1.EN3

Enhance your English language abilities with CLIL activities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the English language.

English Language Course (Elementary Level)

LANG.1.EN2

Enhance your English language abilities with CLIL activities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the English language.

Artificial Intelligence for Education: Exploring the Frontiers of ICT

ICT.1.AI

Gain practical knowledge and strategies for using AI tools such as Chat GPT for language practice. Learn the best practices for implementing AI in the classroom to enhance student engagement and learning outcomes.

Conflict Management, Emotional Intelligence and Bullying Prevention

CLA.1.CON

Acquire an understanding of group dynamics by discovering how tensions, alliances, and relational struggle can interfere with learning. Learn to encourage active listening, empathy, and emotional literacy.

English Language Course for Beginners

LANG.1.EN1

Enhance your English language abilities with CLIL activities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the English language.

Environmental Education: Learning and Acting for a Better Future

SI.1.CLIM

Develop an understanding of the main concepts and issues related to ecology through reflection on the role of education in promoting environmental awareness.

Integrating AI in the Classroom With Critical Thinking

ICT.1.AIC

Gain the knowledge and skills to embrace your role in an AI-driven world and utilize AI tools to enhance student learning. Learn practical strategies for identifying struggling students, creating intelligent tutoring systems, and automating tasks like grading.

Italian Language Course for Beginners

LANG.1.ITA1

Florence Targeted for A1

Enhance your Italian language abilities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the Italian language while diving into Italian culture.

Stress Relief and Well-being Strategies for Teachers

ART.1.SREL

Understand what causes stress and how our bodies react to it. Discover effective strategies to relieve it, and apply them to improve your mental health and well-being.

We Are All Special: Inclusion and Support for Students with Special Needs In and Out of the Classroom

CLA.1.SPE

Explore hands-on activities designed to prevent isolation and disruptive behaviors, with a focus on interaction and support. Discover effective relaxation techniques and movement-based activities suitable for special needs students and the entire class.

Yoga and Meditation for Educators: Be a Great Teacher, Be Your Best Self

ART.1.YOGA

Discover how incorporating yoga practices can enhance your ability to maintain a favorable climate and support resilience both in and out of the classroom. Explore useful tips on introducing children and teens to yoga and meditation techniques.

Artificial Intelligence Tools for Language Teachers

ICT.1.AILA

Amsterdam, Dublin, Florence, Prague, Split, Valencia Targeted for B2-C1 level or above Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Learn how to effectively integrate AI tools into your teaching, enhancing students' language skills, creativity, and critical thinking. Gain the ability to personalize teaching and support students at different language levels.

ChatGPT and Basic AI Tools

ICT.1.GPT

Explore the basic concepts of Artificial Intelligence in education to empower teachers to use basic AI tools, such as ChatGPT, to enhance teaching and learning. Learn how to use AI tools to decrease the workload.

From STEM to STEAM Education: a New Learning Approach

TM.1.STEAM

Learn about STEAM education, a blend of STEM and Arts, for the students to explore the relationship between school subjects and real life.

ICT Tools for School Administration and Non-Teaching Staff

ICT.1.SCST

Berlin, Florence, Ghent, Istanbul Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Learn the expected requirements of administrators and managers from organizations in the Erasmus+ program. Strengthen your digital skills and understanding of ICT and expand your knowledge to improve your technological experience and confidence.

Resilience and Well-being Strengths for Teachers

ART.1.RES

Gain an understanding of the responsibility to cultivate resilience strengths in order to attain a stable state of well-being. Explore strategies such as emotional management, fostering a positive mindset, and cultivating empathy and compassion.

Successful Strategies for Teaching Students with Special Needs in Every Classroom

CLA.1.SN

Explore diverse teaching and assessment methods, strategies, and tools for instructing students with special needs in both mainstream and special education settings. Learn to design differentiated activities effectively in a diverse classroom.

Supporting Diversity with Intercultural Education in the Classroom

CLA.1.SUPP

Discover practical exercises and a legal framework for creating a more inclusive classroom atmosphere. Foster interculturality, respect, and a dynamic environment.

Basic ICT for Teachers: Empowering Classrooms in the Digital Age

ICT.1.SMC

Amsterdam, Barcelona, Florence, Tenerife Basic Computer Proficiency required

Learn to create engaging presentations using tools like Microsoft PowerPoint, Canva, Genially, or Google Slides. Discover how to create materials like quizzes or games and how to navigate the fascinating new world of artificial intelligence.

ICT in the Classroom: Innovative Tools to Facilitate Students Learning, Collaboration and Creativity

ICT.1.COLL

Acquire crucial knowledge to use, select, and effectively incorporate ICT tools in everyday teaching in order to boost creativity, motivation, and engagement.

English for School Administration and Non-Teaching Staff

LANG.1.EADM

Athens, Barcelona, Dublin, Florence, Malta Targeted for A1 Targeted for A2 level or above Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Enhance English language proficiency, both written and spoken, for effective communication in administrative tasks, professional interactions, and cultural immersion.

Environmental Stewardship: How to Reconnect With Nature

SI.1.STEW

Acquire an understanding of ecosystem processes, fostering a sense of responsibility for its preservation. Guide students towards a greener future by encouraging them to view their actions from an environmental perspective.

French Language Course (Intermediate Level)

LANG.1.FRA3

Nice, Paris Targeted for B1 level or above

Enhance your French language abilities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the French language while diving into French culture.

Gender and Sexuality: How to Support and Guide Your Students

CLA.1.SEX

Deepen your understanding of an array of concepts surrounding sexuality, acquiring the capacity to differentiate them and pass the knowledge onto the pupils to create a safe environment that supports them in the disclosure of their own sexuality.

Managing a Diverse Classroom: Facing Upcoming Challenges

CLA.1.DIV

Learn to manage a classroom through experiential learning and develop innovative methods to enhance motivation and collaboration among diverse student groups, including migrants and those with special educational needs.

Motivate Your Students with Growth Mindset Feedback

CSS.1.MOT

Discover the concept of a growth mindset in order to provide the students with purposeful feedback to encourage them to embrace failure and stay focused on their goals. Explore various types of growth-oriented feedback.

Photo and Video Making in your Classroom: the Educational Power of Multimedia

ICT.1.VM

Explore the educational potential of audiovisual content. Learn to create, adapt, and utilize resources to engage students in learning and discover effective tools for managing these resources efficiently.

Project-Based Learning (PBL): Make Students’ Learning Real and Effective!

TM.1.PBL

Discover Project-Based Learning and an array of strategies to integrate into the curriculum using the latest tools and techniques. Create and carry out your own PBL project to boost student engagement and assure long-lasting retention of knowledge.

Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) for Successful Schools

CSS.1.SEL

Learn to develop your own course of action for promoting Social and Emotional Learning in the school through reflection, sharing experiences, and creating a unique path tailored for your school community.

Stress Management and Recognition: Key Strategies for Teachers

ART.1.STRESS

Discover effective stress-management strategies, focusing on emotional intelligence and regulation. Learn how to cope with your own stress and know how to implement these tools in your school to reduce the stress levels of the students.

The 4Cs: Creativity, Critical Thinking, Communication and Collaboration in Schools

CSS.1.4C

Acquire an understanding of the '4C's' and acknowledge their significance as essential life skills. Explore methods for integrating these skills into both the curriculum and the school environment.

Transformational Leadership: How to Empower Followers and Communities

SI.1.TLEA

Discover the key principles and characteristics of transformational leadership, practicing emotional intelligence, active listening, and empathy within the framework of Non-Violent Communication.

Understanding and Supporting Students With ASD and ADHD

CLA.1.ASD

Acquire the skills to effectively teach students with ASD and ADHD, adapting educational techniques to suit their unique learning styles. Provide support in helping them manage impulses and better understand the world around them.

Zero-Waste School

SI.1.ZERO

Gain a comprehensive understanding of zero-waste principles and strategies for waste reduction in schools. Learn to implement sustainable practices, including managing school gardens, promoting slow fashion, and addressing the plastic crisis.

21st Century Skills for Teachers and Students

TM.1.21ST

Discover new methods to help enable, learn and familiarise you and your students about modern 21st century practices which will be useful in nowadays’ education and also serve for future purposes in jobs too.

A Happy Lesson: Valuable Tips to Create a Joyful Classroom

CLA.1.HAPL

Gain more knowledge about the characteristics of a happy mindset and establish routines that lead to joyful days, and practice the 4C’s of education to know and review these vital skills for success in school and beyond.

Agenda 2030: ICT Tools for Sustainable Development

SI.1.AGE

Discover a selection of global goals from the UN’s 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in the classroom with the support of digital technologies.

AI-Powered Content Creation for Educators

ICT.1.AICC

Gain insights into creating engaging learning content that effectively motivates students by mastering Digital/AI Literacy and creative multimedia skills.

Brain-Based Learning: Understand How Students Really Learn

TM.1.BBL

Explore ways to enhance and expedite teaching while ensuring long-lasting knowledge retention. Challenge conventional teaching methods and incorporate fun and creative practices to promote student engagement.

Classroom Management Solutions for Teachers: New Methodologies, Effective Motivation, Cooperation and Evaluation Strategies

CLA.1.CLA

Explore the latest classroom management techniques that promote discussion and problem-solving. Gain familiarity with concepts such as the flipped classroom and other teaching methods aimed at enhancing motivation.

Design the Positive: Positive Thinking, Positive Communication and Positive School Spaces

ART.1.DPO

Acquire key insights into positive communication to nurture a positive mindset and alleviate negative self-talk. Reflect on how the surrounding environment can convert negative communication into positive relationships.

Digital Tools for Collaboration, Communication, Creativity and Critical Thinking (4Cs)

ICT.1.DT4

Acquire the knowledge, the know-how, and the confidence to insert the 4Cs skills into the curriculum and school environment. Learn to design practical activities using ICT resources, which are more efficient at developing the 4Cs in students.

Discovering Renaissance Art in Florence

ART.1.RART

Discover the pearls of the Renaissance in Florence, the home city to some of Western civilization’s greatest works of art and architecture.

Drama Techniques: Developing Self-Expression, Communication and Social Skills for All Students

CSS.1.DTEC

Learn an array of new ways to boost participation, motivation, and confidence in the classroom through the implementation of innovative solutions that are more practical and expressive, and therefore, more enjoyable.

Emotional Intelligence Tools to Understand and Respond to Trauma

CLA.1.EMO

Explore strategies for classroom management that involve teaching emotional intelligence, creating a psychologically safe learning environment, and mitigating the adverse effects of trauma.

Environmental Education in Finland: the Eco-Social Approach

SI.1.EEF

Discover the Finnish approach to environmental education that emphasizes each individual’s capacity to contribute to a sustainable future. Learn to support the students' personal relationship with nature and active citizenship.

Experiential Learning in Tenerife: Through Nature and History

ART.1.EXTE

Discover the practice of Experiential Learning through fun, outdoor activities, with the support of the case study of the fascinating cultural heritage of the Canary Islands.

Facing Diversity: Intercultural Classroom Management

CLA.1.INT

Explore intercultural educational practices and address communication issues. Engage in positive interactions regardless of your or the students' background.

French Language Course (Advanced Level)

LANG.1.FRA4

Nice, Paris Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Enhance your French language abilities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the French language while diving into French culture.

Happy Schools: Positive Education for Well-Being and Life-Skills Development

ART.1.HA

Learn to design programs that integrate academics with character strengthening and well-being by exploring the fundamentals of Positive Psychology, along with the theories and techniques of Positive Education.

ICT and Outdoor Teaching and Learning

ICT.1.OUT

Acquire an understanding of the support that any external environment can provide in outdoor teaching with the aid of the right ICT tools. Discover an array of practice examples to design novel tasks and activities for the students.

Inclusive Teaching with Artificial Intelligence

ICT.1.ITAI

Gain insights into best practices for implementing AI to promote inclusion. Acquire the ability to integrate AI tools into lessons and activities, in order to enhance student engagement and learning outcomes.

Italian Language Course (Advanced Level)

LANG.1.ITA4

Florence Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Enhance your Italian language abilities, focusing on vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, and conversational skills. Boost your confidence in reading, writing, and speaking the Italian language while diving into Italian culture.

Leadership and Management for School Principals

SI.1.LMA

Work on your leadership strengths while also recognizing potential areas for growth and realistic solution strategies. Develop your professional role as leaders and identify with it.

Mental Health Awareness for Teachers and Students

ART.1.MENT

Develop an understanding of mental health awareness in order to identify potential issues, in both colleagues and students. Implement appropriate support strategies and learn how to foster teacher well-being.

Mindfulness for Teachers: a Hands-on Approach

ART.1.MIND

Develop an understanding of the positive impact of mindfulness practices on mood, communication, and stress levels. Discover a variety of practices to use for yourself and/or introduce to students.

Our School Radio! Podcasts and New Media as an Educational Tool

ICT.1.RAD

Deepen the knowledge about podcasts as an easily accessible online tool that can provide students with useful knowledge. Teach the students how to make a podcast by explaining strategies for storytelling and interviewing, among others.

SEL in the Digital Age: Leveraging AI for Student Well-being and Success

CSS.1.SELD

Barcelona, Dublin, Split, Valencia Basic Computer Proficiency required

Explore how educational technologies and AI can enhance SEL by fostering self-awareness, empathy, collaboration, and responsibility. Learn to create supportive digital environments that promote students' social and emotional well-being.

Teaching for a Sustainable World: Climate Change and Global Citizenship

SI.1.GCE

Deepen your knowledge about issues connected to climate change and incorporate these themes into your teaching. Develop practical strategies and create projects involving the entire school.

The Democratic Life in the EU: Teaching Citizen Rights and Duties

SI.1.DLEU

Explore the fundamentals of the rights as an EU citizen and discover to the notion of democratic life. Examine the UN Convention of the Rights of the Child, to teach your students their rights and duties as citizens of the Union.

The Fundamental ICT Tools for Education

ICT.1.FUN

Athens, Rome, Split, Valencia Basic Computer Proficiency required

Expand your knowledge of ICT and social technologies for education. Gain insight into the top teaching and learning apps, innovative digital solutions and social platforms: Snapseed, PhotoGrid, Edpuzzle, Weebly, Google + and more.

Transforming Education: Integrating AI, AR, VR, and 3D Printing for Effective Learning

ICT.1.AAV3

Discover how to effectively leverage AI, AR, VR, and 3D printing technologies in education. Acquire practical knowledge and hands-on experience to seamlessly integrate these tools into your teaching.

Understanding Divisions: Insights from Dublin and Belfast, Brexit, and EU’s History

SI.1.BELF

Dive into Ireland's long history of division and explore how Brexit has affected its relationship with the EU. Experience the differences between the Republic and Northern Ireland firsthand through a full-day trip to Belfast and other excursions.

AI and the 6Cs for Future-Ready Teaching

ICT.1.6CS

Explore AI tools that enhance teaching and learning in the context of the 6Cs. Create a collaborative, inclusive, and digitally-enhanced learning environment.

Ambassadors of Democracy: Building a Democratic Culture in Schools

SI.1.AMB

Integrate the development of competencies for democratic culture and intercultural dialogue into their school mission. Identify the values, attitudes, skills, knowledge, and critical understanding, the four pillars of the CDC model.

Art, Music, and Dance Therapy for an Inclusive Classroom

ART.1.AMD

Discover the power of creativity for creating an inclusive classroom and fostering motivation, autonomy, self-esteem, participation, and collaboration.

Basic English for European Projects

LANG.1.BEEP

Enhance your English communication skills and explore the new European School Education Platform. Learn how to create and manage a project according to the eTwinning quality criteria.

Boost Your English While Discussing Trending Topics in Education

LANG.1.BOO

Amsterdam, Dublin, Malta, Split, Valencia Targeted for B1 level or above

Acquire a new lexicon and learn to make deeper connections and understanding with peers, discussing the trending topics in education.

Classroom Debates: Turn Them Into an Effective Teaching Tool

CSS.1.DEB

Develop an understanding of the numerous benefits of implementing debates in your curriculum. Use debates as a tool to develop critical thinking, acquire crucial research skills, foster appreciation for diverse views, and improve engagement.

CLIL in Practice: Focus on Ireland

LANG.1.IRE

Dublin Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Explore a multidisciplinary approach to CLIL resources and aids for preparing materials and interactive content for non-native language learners. Discover the people and places that constitute the history of Ireland along the way.

CLIL in Practice: Focus on the EU

LANG.1.CLEU

Brussels, Dublin, Florence, Lisbon Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Learn how to use CLIL effectively to integrate EU-related topics into your curriculum. Gain experience with how to create new content for the classroom with authentic materials about the European Union.

Coaching and Mentoring to Support Teachers

SI.1.COAM

Learn the basic principles and techniques of mentoring, while developing crucial skills such as rapport-building and classroom observation. Gain an understanding of how to contribute to building a school culture.

Creative Strategies for Language Teachers: Make it Easy, Make it Real!

LANG.1.CRE

Amsterdam, Barcelona, Florence, Nice, Trapani Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Learn how to create an effective learning environment through the integration of an array of educational tools that support various learning styles. Discover strategies to develop the students’ language skills.

Cultivating Diversity and Inclusion

CLA.1.CDI

Learn how to foster diversity and inclusion by creating a safe and welcoming learning environment and promoting cultural awareness among the pupils.

Cultural Heritage Education: Ancient Greece as a Case Study

TM.1.HER

Find out how to promote and transmit a sense of European identity and social inclusion by discovering the importance and value of cultural heritage. Learn how different identities can enrich each other.

Deep Democracy: How to Manage Conflicts Building a Strong Classroom Culture

CLA.1.DEE

Discover new strategies to manage the classroom and help the students understand each other by encouraging respect and empathy to build positive relations.

Designing Inclusive Learning Environments to Support all Students

CLA.1.DILE

Learn to establish a framework of inclusive values and practices, both within a school and in collaboration between institutions, as a strategy to deal with diversity in an appropriate and sensitive manner.

Digital Citizenship and Media Literacy: Sharing the Responsibility

ICT.1.DCI

Barcelona, Ghent, Helsinki, Nice Basic Computer Proficiency required

Acquire an awareness of the morality and consequences of your own online activities, therefore developing the capacity to enhance digital literacy in the classroom.

Digital Storytelling: Apps and Software for Creative Writing

ICT.1.DSTOR

Acquire the necessary skills to create audio-visual stories with the support of an array of ICT tools and software, such as Microsoft Photos, which are effective in the involvement of students in the classroom.

Digital Tools for Cultural Heritage Education

ART.1.DTCH

Delve into digital technologies for teaching Cultural Heritage. Explore digital tools, multimedia resources, and interactive platforms to create engaging lessons.

Discovering Modernism and Avant-Garde in Barcelona

ART.1.MODE

Acquire a solid knowledge of the artistic and architectural panorama in Barcelona. Practice a variety of engaging learning activities (such as Visual Thinking Strategies, sketching, and Catalan mosaic making), to engage the classroom.

Discovering the Cultural Heritage of Rome

ART.1.ROM

Discover the astonishing cultural heritage of Rome, which will be taken as an example to explain the principles of Cultural Heritage Education.

Eco-Anxiety: From Negative Emotions to Positive Actions and Hopes

SI.1.ANX

Enhance your ability to recognize emotions related to environmental issues in both yourself and your students. Explore various ways to support your students' emotional processes and foster their emotional resilience.

Embracing Diversity, Preventing Bullying and Violence

CLA.1.VIO

Deepen the knowledge of the underlying dynamics of discrimination and bullying in schools, as they tend to have negative effects on learning.

English Course for Absolute Beginners With the Callan Method

LANG.1.CAL

Rome, Split Targeted for A1

Learn the basis of English thanks to the Callan Method, focusing on building gradually longer and more complex sentences through repetition, building vocabulary, and grammar skills in the process.

Flipped Classroom

TM.1.FLIP

Develop a full understanding of the flipped classroom strategy, a pedagogical model that reverses the mainstream lecture-and-homework structure of a course. Learn how to integrate this model into the classroom to promote active learning.

Game Design for Teaching and Learning

TM.1.GDTL

Learn the difference between Game-Based Learning, Gamification, and Game Design. Be familiar with Inquiry-Based Learning. Learn to run short game jams, and discover the different steps of game design.

Help Your Students Cope With Stress and Anxiety Thanks to Bibliotherapy

ART.1.BIB

Explore the fundamentals of bibliotherapy for good emotional health through literature. Learn to develop lesson plans and bibliotherapy activities based on relevant children’s books.

ICT Tools for CLIL

ICT.1.I4C

Dublin, Lisbon, Rome, Valencia Intermediate Computer Proficiency required Targeted for B1 level or above

Explore strategies and ways to effectively introduce CLIL in the classroom, along with a selection of ICT tools focusing on content, communication, cognition, and culture.

Instructional Strategies to Address the Diverse Needs of All Students

CLA.1.INS

Discover the approach for Universal Design Learning and the strategy for Differentiation, to design an accessible educational framework that addresses the needs of all students.

Introducing Sustainability Through Game-Based Learning and Gamification

SI.1.SUSG

Explore the educational benefits of GBL and gamification methodologies. Learn how to design and implement effective lesson plans and how to use them efficiently when discussing sustainability.

Learn to Teach Any Subject with Drama

CSS.1.LTENG

Discover a variety of drama strategies and learn to modify and integrate them into lessons, designing engaging learning activities.

Learning in Motion: Exploring the Link Between Movement, Play, and Academic Success

TM.1.LM

Learn the benefits of incorporating movement, play, and active games into the lessons to enhance learning, motivation, and concentration.

Life Coaching for Teachers: Happy Teachers for Better Students

ART.1.COA

Acquire an understanding of the importance of setting healthy boundaries to cope with overworking. Learn how to regulate emotions and respond assertively but appropriately.

Math + Games x Innovation = Fun²

TM.1.MFUN

Learn how to teach mathematics in a practical and fun way to captivate the students with the beauty and functionality of numbers. Discover how to use games, role play, and interactive activities that go far beyond the textbook.

Mindset Mastery: Building Lifelong Habits for Learning and Growth

TM.1.MMAS

Master the art of habit formation to enhance teaching efficiency and student learning outcomes. Learn strategies for developing and sustaining a growth mindset in themselves and their students.

Neuroscience: Understand How Your Students Learn

SI.1.NEU

Deepen your understanding of the learning process, assisting your students in reaching their full potential. Discover how to integrate realistic neuroeducation strategies into the classroom for long-lasting retention of knowledge.

Pathways to Become a Digitally Competent Educator

ICT.1.DCE

Reflect on and acquire technological skills specific to educators. Learn to effectively integrate technology, empowering students to develop their digital competences. Discover a variety of assessment and progress analysis strategies.

Preventing Early School Leaving: Strategies and Tools for Teachers

CLA.1.EASL

Explore different tools to prevent early school leaving and engage in practical activities to assess the risks and potentialities of your schools. Focus on national and international youth exchanges, trips, and different activities.

Project-Based Learning (PBL) in Museums and Cultural Heritage Sites

TM.1.MCHS

Discover how to build and implement PBL strategies in the classroom, incorporating activities and information from museums and cultural heritage sites into these projects. Learn how to organize engaging and immersive cultural visits through PBL.

Project-Based Learning for Pre-school

TM.1.PBPR

Discover PBL through inspiring examples and learn how to incorporate it into your teaching. Identify tools for preschool students and become a mentor promoting problem-solving, critical thinking, autonomy, collaboration, and 21st-century skills.

Project-Based Learning for Primary School

TM.1.PBLP

Deepen your knowledge about PBL. Discover which tools are best for the students, how to effectively evaluate their learning, and how to be a good mentor in order to promote critical thinking, autonomy, collaboration, and other 21st-century skills.

Rediscovering the Roots of Democracy: From Ancient Greece to the European Union

SI.1.ROO

Explore Ancient Greek democracy and its influence on modern societies and lifestyles. Reflect on current values and principles within the EU and discover strategies to empower students as active members of society.

Refresher Course for Already Practicing English Language Teachers (ESL, EFL, ESOL)

LANG.1.TEFL

Budapest, Dublin, Florence, Nice, Rome Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Enhance your teaching by incorporating CLT methods, implementing task-based learning, and using authentic materials. Explore innovative approaches to customize your teaching based on student needs and current language teaching methodologies.

Soft Skills for Strong Teachers

CSS.1.SKI

Deepen your understanding of the notion of soft skills and reflect on your own leadership, creativity, and communication abilities, among others. Learn how to incorporate the transmission of those skills into every facet of education.

Tablets and Smartphones: Using Mobile Devices as Educational Tools

ICT.1.TAB

Discover new ways to incorporate technology into your lessons, learn how to use software, social media platforms, and apps for communication, group management, and fostering collaboration, while discussing ethical and safety issues.

The 5Es Instructional Model: Effective Teaching in Limited Time

TM.1.5E

Discover the powerful framework of the 5Es: Engage, Explore, Explain, Elaborate and Evaluate. Master artificial intelligence tools and techniques to help manage time and ensure that learning goals are reached in every 1-hour session.

The 8Rs of Environmental Education and Sustainability

SI.1.8RS

Acquire skills and strategies for integrating sustainable practices into classroom activities. Create actionable plans to implement and maintain sustainable practices in educational settings.

The Best Digital Tools for Language Teachers

LANG.1.TOOL

Amsterdam, Barcelona, Dublin, Nice, Trapani Targeted for B2-C1 level or above Basic Computer Proficiency required

Learn to integrate educational apps and digital tools into your teaching methodology and discover the latest approaches. Foster students’ engagement and motivation and acquire the necessary tools to support each of your pupils’ learning styles.

The Group First! Practical Exercises for Collaboration and Team-Building

CSS.1.TGF

Encourage empathy and active listening among students through cultivating teamwork and mutual respect. Employ interactive activities that involve both physical and mental engagement, utilizing the classroom environment and outdoor areas.

Traditional Arts and ICT Art Tools for Teaching your Subjects and Promoting Life Skills

ART.1.TICT

Learn to integrate traditional art techniques and ICT art tools into your teaching practices in order to boost creativity and critical thinking, and enhance the development of crucial life skills.

Use ICT to Integrate Migrant Students in your Classroom

CLA.1.IMI

Dublin, Florence, Nice, Valencia Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Explore valuable ICT tools and educational strategies to seamlessly integrate migrants, refugees, and asylum seekers into classrooms. Develop essential skills to foster social inclusion among students from diverse cultural backgrounds.

4Cs Education with AI Tools and Storytelling Techniques

CSS.1.4CAI

Berlin, Dublin, Lisbon, Split Basic Computer Proficiency required

Discover how to blend AI tools with education to enhance soft skills among students. Gain practical AI tool insights and storytelling skills to transform your teaching and inspire students across all subjects, preparing them for a future intertwined with AI.

5 Steps to Improve Teaching and Learning

TM.1.5ST

Develop an understanding of the notions of formative feedback and active learning in the context of student-centered learning methods. Discover how to develop a plan to introduce changes to your curriculum to avoid ineffective teaching.

A European School for All Children

SI.1.ESC

Discover how to create a completely inclusive environment tailored for multicultural, mixed-ability classrooms comprised of students with various educational needs.

A Satisfying School Experience: Strategies and Skills for Teachers

CSS.1.SAT

Discover innovative approaches to create a meaningful school experience and explore practical ideas for fostering a dynamic, creative environment. Improve student engagement and promote healthy school-family relations with these strategies.

Active Art: Understanding and Enjoying Art in the Classroom and Beyond

ART.1.ACT

Develop an understanding of art and creativity in different contexts to effectively deal with their students’ creative process. Find out new ways of combining art theory and practice.

Advanced Artificial Intelligence for Education

ICT.1.ADAI

Dublin, Ghent, Nicosia, Rome Advanced Computer Proficiency required

Master advanced AI-driven tools and techniques to enhance your teaching practices. Learn strategies for maintaining a healthy balance between online and offline educational activities.

AI Ethics and Bias: Diversity, Inclusion, and Representation in AI Tools

ICT.1.AIET

Athens, Budapest, Florence, Tenerife Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Gain proficiency in seamlessly incorporating AI tools into teaching, addressing bias, adapting materials for accessibility, and crafting customized activities.

AI-Enhanced Learning Experiences: The Future of Education

ICT.1.AIEN

Amsterdam, Dublin, Prague, Valencia Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Gain a deep understanding of AI’s role and impact on educational leadership for K-12 institutions. Discover how to use AI assistant tools for strategic planning in educational settings.

Arts for the Inclusion of Migrants, Refugees, and Disadvantaged Populations

ART.1.MIG

Discover how to transcend language and cultural barriers in order to create a completely inclusive environment, sensible to residual effects of trauma and relocation.

Bullying Prevention and EdTech for a Wholesome School Environment

CLA.1.BICT

Istanbul, Malta Basic Computer Proficiency required

Learn how to create a healthy learning environment where bullying and discrimination prevention will be taken care of. Get inspired on how to integrate ICT into class, practicing methodologies to understand prejudice and prevent conflicts.

Capture Cities’ Cultural Heritage with Video Reportage

ART.1.CCCH

Istanbul, Rome Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Develop your skills in collaborative learning, storytelling, and gaining a new perspective on the world around you by creating engaging video content using free ICT tools and software.

CLIL and PBL to Improve Student Engagement

LANG.1.PBLL

Barcelona, Budapest, Dublin, Florence Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Develop the ability to guide students in the acquisition of knowledge and life skills by linking curriculum topics to real-life situations. Discover Project-Based Learning and Content and Language Integrated Learning approaches.

CLIL for Physical Education Teachers

LANG.1.PECLIL

Split, Tenerife Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Learn how to integrate content-based language learning with Physical Education lessons through practical demonstration, encouragement of reflection.

CLIL in Secondary School: Practical Activities for All Teachers

LANG.1.SECO

Dublin, Florence, Lisbon, Tenerife Targeted for B2-C1 level or above

Discover the latest methods for sourcing, choosing, and adapting your content ahead of your lessons in Secondary Schools, and how Content and Language Integrated Learning promotes interdisciplinarity that enhances motivation in the classroom.

Coding and Robotics Made Easy

ICT.1.CORO

Dublin, Malta, Rome, Split Intermediate Computer Proficiency required

Learn the fundamentals of coding and robotics, and develop the skills necessary to use these tools in the classroom in a fun and interesting manner. Learn how to bridge the gap between software and hardware.

Cultivating Self-Esteem: A Practical Guide for Teachers and Principals

CSS.1.SELF
